block.p: Meredith Ann Snow, the daughter of Ernestine Snow-Bartmess of Prospect, Conn., and the late Edward Snow Jr., was married yesterday to Jonathan Wilson Meeks, a son of Berneda Meeks and Dr. Louis Meeks of Newton, Mass. The Rev. Philip Laplante, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Victories Church in Boston.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Yale University, where they met.

Meredith Ann Snow, the daughter of Ernestine Snow-Bartmess of Prospect, Conn., and the late Edward Snow Jr., was married yesterday to Jonathan Wilson Meeks, a son of Berneda Meeks and Dr. Louis Meeks of Newton, Mass. The Rev. Philip Laplante, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Victories Church in Boston.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Yale University, where they met.

Mrs. Meeks, 26, is a product manager at UPromise Inc., an Internet-based financial services company in Brookline, Mass. Her mother teaches Spanish and is the head of the foreign language department at Kennedy High School in Waterbury, Conn. The bride's father taught history and math at the Wallace Middle School in Waterbury. The bride is the stepdaughter of Bruce Bartmess.

Mr. Meeks, 27, is a vice president and investment adviser in the technology group at TA Associates, a venture capital firm in Boston. His father, an orthopedic surgeon, is a partner in Meeks/Zilberfarb Orthopedics Associates in Brookline, and is a clinical instructor of orthopedic surgery at Harvard University.
